review: In situations where Levofloxacin and Cefaclor are not available, this drug is a good substitute for prostatitis.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I developed a case of prostatitis. Was given Bactrim and told to take 2 pills for 30 days. After about day 3 or 4, I started getting flank pain. I called the doc and he said Bactrim won't cause that. Maybe I have a stone forming. Did some research online and found that Bactrim is not recommended for people with kidney issues. It can cause them to shut down. I'm currently out of town, 5 hours from home, and in quite a bit of pain. I plan to head home in the morning without taking my morning dose and go straight to the hospital.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Was prescribed bactrim 2x/day for 30 days for prostatitis symptoms.First day fine but by third day throbbing neck pain that aspirin or tylenol didn't take care of. No excessive leaning forward or sleeping on my stomach to crank the neck so I believe it was from the drug. Little bit of nausea and anxiety at the same time.Hard to say if it did much for my prostate because by the time I started I was 70% better from my initial doctor visit.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I went to the doctor for Prostatitis and was RX Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole).  Some background, I have high functioning anxiety and decided to write this review while I wait for my DR to call me back about changing ABX.  These other reviews are 100% accurate about severe anxiety (heart rate over 90 BPM 24/7), headaches, loss of appetite, and nausea....nothing better than throwing up stomach bile because you can't eat.  I thought I had COVID but tested negative...On the bright side, after 3 days my prostatitis went away, I guess it's a double edge sword.

Started twice daily. Plan was for 50 days. Was getting sick after 5 days. Figured my body would sort it out and deal with it. At 12 days uncontrollable diarhea and too sick to move out of bed. Even uncontrollable diarrhea in bed. Stopped it 15 hours ago. Feel slightly better. Now to research the next horrible drug.  It actually did help the prostate problems somewhat. Wish I could have stayed on it. God knows I tried.

Ok so went to the doc cause I was having some funny pains down stairs Told me he thought it might be some kind of infection prescribed sulpha and off. I went not thinking much of it at all after 3 days I told my wife I didn’t feel rite was shaky had no appetite nothing tasted good I couldn’t sleep had severe anxiety that I’ve never experienced before with two hard core panic attacks and I also had some thoughts of suicide especially on New Year’s Day. My last dose was Dec 4 and I dealt with the side effects till early February and for 3 to 4 weeks my body felt like it was poisoned I don’t know if this medicine even helped cause everything else was so bad it took my attention away from the pain
Bactrim works great for me when I have prostatitis, no side effects. Clears infection fast.

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):24 yo Male, No side effect symptoms on this, while I had moderate symptoms with Doxy. While it did not completely clear up the main issue (yet, still have about 5 days left on it out of a 45 day supply), it did help

I was prescribed SIX WEEKS treatment of Bactrim for prostatitis.  (The additional two drugs intended to treat the urination issues were so terrible that I stopped them after a few days).  My symptoms improved dramatically by the second week of Bactrim, but I was experiencing the headaches, which were manageable.Worse were the gastrointestinal problems. I was familiar with these from Augmentin, but they are common with all broad-spectrum antibiotics.  Fortunately, it occurred to me to take PRObiotics to restore the GOOD bacteria in the gut that the ANTIbiotics were killing.  This has eliminated the diarrhea. In retrospect, I probably should have tried the Urologist's suggestion of Levaquin, but I had had a reaction to it years ago, and I didn't want to try that again.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Took Bactrim forte for prostatitis 2x a day, at the beginning I just had a mild itch but by day 5 my eyes became red and started seeing floaters in my vision, at this point I had to stop. Be careful with this drug .

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I’ve been on bactrim for almost three months for Prostatitis which is getting better slowly.  Having some lower back pain.  Has anyone else had to be on a bactrim  for this long to cure this problem.  During all this the pain started in my testicles and went up into pain behind my penis.  So tired of this pain.  Anyone else have the same issues?

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I’ve been on Bactrim for over 5 weeks- prostatitis. I have 5 days left and my prostate is still swollen as it was when I was on other stuff. I was on Cipro at first but after the 3rd day the side effects hit me too hard so I got taken off of it and started a 2 week course of tetracycline until I could get into the urologist office. But since this Coronavirus came into play. They canceled that appointment so I had to make different appointment at the doctors and tell them that tetracycline is worthless against this type of thing. So then I got out on Bactrim. Bactrim helped after day 5 but I haven’t seen really any improvement since.

Septra (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Septra killed my father at the very young age of 36 years young. It gave  A-plastic Enemia. dads family doctor of Pikeville Kentucky administered the drug for prostate infection. I was 11, my brother 13, my sister 18 months and my sweet strong mother 33 becomes a widow. Dad became extremely weak and he never missed work he was a coal miner. He missed work to go see his dr & his doc sent him by ambulance to Lexington Kentucky st Joshep Hospital to a friend doc of doc Johnson’s. He lived bout a month. His name Charles Edward Coleman RIP DADDY I LOVE ❤️ YOU. DADDY LOVED HIS FAMILY

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Bactrim almost finished me. Should have known as it wasn't working anyway and I was getting the DS prescription. Suddenly became very ill, needed to go to the hospital for IV fluids, had a terrible reaction , like the worst flu I ever experienced.  2 weeks later I am still getting ringing in my ears, and watching my skin carefully, fearfully as I broke out with nasty boils all over my arms and legs. If there is permanent damage I am considering the possibility of starting a lawsuit as my health seems to have been permanently damaged. I'd never been this sick with anything like this, and I am 68 years old, have always been in good health until now! I am very angry that a prescribed medication like this could be almost lethal to me.

I took Bactrim DS for about 6 weeks because my doctor thought I had prostatitis. I had no side effects except for feeling unwell the first day or two. I also had a horrible headache the second night but I don’t know if that was the Bactrim or not. Unfortunately the problem wasn’t fixed and I had to get a test done to check for bacteria in prostate. Doctor got results and prescribed me The generic for Levaquin. Going to see about a different prescription as I don’t like the possibility of side effects with Levaquin.

Prescribed this for slight prostatitis. Urinating more at night then before, can't sleep for longer than 3-4 hours because of need to urinate. Before I could sleep at night and use restroom only once, now am using bathroom roughly at 3am, and again at around 6am.

My husband died taking this drug while on a blood thinner.  In large/extended time doses can cause thrombocytopenia. He was prescribed 160 mg dose for 30 daysHad a massive stroke for no apparent reason.  At time of death he had thrombocytopenia and nobody knew it. He had taken Bactrim for 14 days.

While I have not had any stomach, heart, dizziness, or anxiety issues, I feel like I have had a headache from day 1 of taking this antibiotic combo pill sulfamethoxazole with trimethoprim, my side effect is I have a constant pain in the base of my skull in the back. I can get rid of it with ibruprofen, but I have to take this stuff for 3 weeks for prostatitis. Not fun.

This antibiotic sulfamethoxazole with trimethoprim has been the absolute worst drug/medication I have ever taken in my entire life. From what I have seen in these reviews and from my personal experience, it should be a crime to state that the only side effect is diarrhea and that all other side effects are "rare". Not only did I have a constant 101-102 temperature fever with chills, nausea, and headache, I also got to experience about 70% of the so-called "rare" symptoms neck and cheek swelling, constant face and chest itching, muscle pains sharp pains not soreness, tight chest, joint pains that are sharp, restless and sleepless nights, and so much more. I'm not sure if my condition was worse for the rest of my life or the 10 days of hell on this antibiotic.

I was put on this drug 14 days ago for suspected Prostatitis. 2 times a day x 15 days. 2 material side effects have been noted, definitely related to this drug. 1) Difficulty getting to sleep and staying asleep. 2) I used to be able to go all night without getting up to pee. At first I started getting up at 3 or 4 with a second trip to the toilet at 6 or 7. Last couple of nights I've been getting up every 1.5-2 hours (and during the day as well). Flow is also very weak.Getting a PSA test in 2 days. I hope this drug has done its job.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Had TURP 17 years ago for prostate ....not a great success.Recently had discomfort and some blood passing post arousal.Not sure if prostatisis or UTI or both.Doc prescribed 10 days Bactrim 800mg at 2 per day.All clear after 2 days, but some minor hives.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Horrible .  After taking Bactrim for prostatitis I have pain in fingers ,toes ,shoulder, elbow, wrist, knees, ankles after 14 days .Sudden on set at that time. Stopped taking it started claritin and tagamet, pain free after 24 hrs.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was trying to get well, I need to have both knees replaced, I could not urinate, I had a infection in my prostrate  so I was put on Bactrim   800/160  2 per day  for forty two days. After 2 days my knees stopped being painful all time and I could walk easy again, I could not believe it, nobody else believed it either. I took it for 30 days like candy, no problems. Doctor took me off of Bactrim and 2 days later the pain returned in my knees. I ask my Doc. if I could take the rest of my 16 pills she said yes, took one a day and pain went away again. I need more pills and maybe I will not need knee replacement.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This stuff should be out of market. I took it 3.5 days and got almost all side effects of it. The worse is anxiety which  you cannot get rid/reverse until last drop of Bactrim leaves your body, not talking about kidney, lung damage plus super muscle pains. Drink a lot of water and quit it once you notice that this drug is not for you. Just thankful that I am alive...

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Took Bactrim for 2 weeks and flu like symptoms the entire time. Eventually broke out in hives after 2 weeks and was told I was allergic. BUT my prostate swelling is down and I feel better. So it put me through the mill but it took care of the underlying issue. I’ve been itching for 4 days after taking my last pill. Hope to be itch free soon.

Been taking the sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim combo tablet for 4 days for severe prostatitis which   has worked wonders.   BUT I get painful leg cramps a couple of hours after taking the pill which decrease about the time I'm coming up on my second dose of the day.  So far, the infection relief is worth the leg cramps.  Going to drink a lot more water to see if this helps with leg ache.  If not, will call my doctor on Monday.

Never had any challenges with antibiotics before, this stuff destroyed my sleep cycle and I'm still trying to get it back in sync 6 months later. There may have been additional neurological damage only I couldn't tell if that was from the Bactrim or from the Xanax I was prescribed trying to make myself sleep again. Two thumbs WAY down!

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Bad side effects to the extent that I had to stop after 2 days.  Flu like symptoms, bad headache, pain in muscles and joints, low fever, no energy, could not eat, nausea - you name it, I had it.  Too bad as I think it was starting to knock down my bacterial prostatitis.  The Flu like symptoms were so convincing that I stopped for a few days, felt better, then started again just to make certain I didn't have the Flu.

I took Bactrim for 28 days (along with 400mg Ibuprofen 2 x daily and a zinc/curcumin/resveratrol supplement 1 x daily. I had no side effects and symptoms GREATLY improved. Once the Bactrim was finished, I took 200mg Ibuprofen 2 x daily for the next week along with the supplement. I only gave Bactrim a "7" as I don't believe it would have worked alone to completely heal my prostate. I had to make dietary changes (no milk, more veggies/ greens and no caffeine/alcohol/ spicy foods) and take other things in combination with this medication.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Prescibed Bactrim for prostatitis. Was showing good improvement after 5 days.  Day 9, big full body hives develop and had to stop.  Dr. thought I was allergic to the sulfa component of bactrim so he prescibed Trimethoprim(the other component in Bactrim) by itself a week later. After 1 pill the hives start again... Was switched to Cipro with slight improvement and then to Doxycycline which is significantly helping after 4 weeks. Going to continue it as long as I'm improving . 70% better now.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took one pill of a two week prescription and immediately had a splitting headache. Six hours later I had difficulty breathing. Body aches and joint pain also kicked in. Two days later I am finally starting to feel better, but my right knee still hurts. This drug is (almost) banned in the U.K.  And should be looked at by the FDA.  You need to know if you are allergic to the sulfa class of drugs before even thinking about taking this drug.

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Dr Prescribed this med for my Prostatitis symptoms, on day 5 of a 28 day plan.  Noticeable reduction in symptoms so far. Pain seems to be fading as the days pass.  Was told to take the whole prescription as just because the symptoms fade doesn't mean it's gone.  Some light side effects are light headed, occasional nausea, and some interrupted sleep, some body tingling also during the day.  But if it makes these symptoms go away it's worth the tradeoff.  Better than feeling like your bladder area is on fire.  If you can handle the slight side effects for a couple of weeks I would recommend give this a try.  Although everyone is different and side effects may differ.

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was originally prescribed Cipro to treat my prostatitis. After 6 days Cipro proved ineffective for the particular bacteria I had. Switched to SMZ-TMP in addition to Flomax and already feel relief on day 2. SMZ-TMP was free at my local Publix. I would have given it a 10 if I wasn't taking it in combination with Flomax (which is also having positive results).

Hi I had all these symptoms last year and they have returned. Only this time they gave me 4 weeks of the antibiotic drug trimethoprim.  So far it's caused my urine to smell funny, slight back pain and pins needles, numbness in my hands I'm also waiting on a PSA and creatnine blood tests I think 1 is to check if the kidneys are function properly and also a PSA blood check to see if any cancer is present. I had all this done last year but was only given a weeks cause of these but I don't find them very effective whatsoever. However the GP as gave me doxycycline 100mg which I had to ask for by name as she said these ones should sort it so I explained to my doctor I need another antibiotic so she did gave me doxycycline 100mg.

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took this for prostatitis last year and I'm on it for the same thing again this year. Last time i was on it, it helped the infection but the infection did not completely go away, and I had to go on a different antibiotic. I have had a tough time getting a good night of sleep since I started taking it. I wake up many times a night and lay awake in bed quite often. It's annoying but I've had worse drug interactions. It's extremely cheap which is a positive.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):It would be a mission to complete 6 week of dosage but eventually it will provide relief but long duration is a problem. You feel depressed and gait disorder is also there...
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This is the best medicine as it never ceases to response in extreme cases.and takes 4 weeks course to resolve the issue.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):After 3 1/2 weeks, I developed a skin rash, which started itching horribly. The rash and itching continued for two weeks (13 days) after stopping the medication. Apparently Sulfa allergies are fairly common. Benadryl helped the itching a bit.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Did not work

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Bactrim cured my prostatitis within two weeks, however I had to stop taking it earlier than prescribed because I discovered I was allergic. I noticed flu-like symptoms, including chills, fever, and horrible muscle aches. On top of that, I developed a head to toe rash that itched like crazy. Imagine being sore and itchy at the same time. Luckily, all of this subsided within a few days of quitting Bactrim. Since the antibiotic kills bacteria everywhere, I noticed I had flawless skin for about a week. But that didn't last. The bacteria came back with a vengeance and I developed the worst acne of my life. I'm now taking doxycycline and using expensive creams to combat this. It's been two months since I stopped Bactrim and I am still breaking out!

Septra DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I've been having some discomfort that my doctor felt could be prostatitis. So, until I could get in for a CT Scan and also see a urologist, he put me on Septra DS.  Everything was going fine until day 6.  I was on my 23 anniversary weekend and I got up that morning to take a nice hot bath in the hot tub in our room. When I got out of the hot tub and started to dry off I noticed hives on my inner thighs.  Looking in the mirror, I noticed that I was also covered in hives from my armpit to my waist on both sides.  The culprit?  Septra DS.  Within the next few hours I was covered on my back, stomach, legs, arms, and a few on my lips. Allergic reaction.
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Good medicine but takes 4-6 weeks to resolve.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Every two years I get Prostatitis, Bactrim works all the time

I was given this medication after a routine checkup which concluded after the results from the blood tests proved my chances for prostate cancer have doubled over the last years test. I was 52 and hard as a rock and in denial, Therefore I took none of the medication. And told no one including my wife as well. She deals with enough without having to worry about me. Wrong decesion ! I was to take all this medication within a month and report in to the Va for a second test in order to determine my possible prostrate cancer. This never happened. Long story short. I have prostate cancer and feel I have let my family down due to my stubbornness. For all you rock hard Johns lose the stubbornness or lose 10 years or more of your life. Like myself.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Used it to combat Prostate infection.  Did nothing to help.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Didn't work

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed Bactrim for Prostatitis. I took it for 3 days and only had significant side effects. I've never had a medicinal reaction in my life before this.
